are destinations in their own rights and are covered in separate articles.
makes a regular stop at the
provides hourly service from Tokyo and the journey takes roughly 4hrs from Tokyo, 2.5hrs from Sendai and 1hr from Morioka. Please make sure to book your seat in advance, as seats on all
trains are all reserved. Japan Rail Pass is accepted.

content=This onsen has the highest flow rate in Japan at 150 liters/second.

content=In this festival dating back more than a century, large decorated paper balloons are lit and float off in the evening sky.  The evening can get cold, so warm clothing is recommended.

content=Located at the foot of the  Mt. Akita-Koma. View of Lake Tazawa is great.

content=This mountain is active volcano, and the highest mountain in Akita prefecture. View of Lake Tazawa from the top is wonderful. Roadway through to 8Gōme (80% on the mountain) parking. Climbing 2hrs round trip to the top from 8Gōme.

content=The name of the mountain means "nipple". It was named from the shape of the mountain as seen from the Akita side is similar to the female breast. There are alpine plants and wetlands near the top. Climbing 4 - 5hrs round trip to the top from Kuroyu Onsen in
. After climbing, you can take a tired by hot spring.
